name: LoadData do not use on sqlday

source:
from azure.storage.blob import BlobServiceClient, BlobClient, ContainerClient
import requests
import pandas as pd
import zipfile
import io
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

sas_token = f'sp=racwdlm&st=2023-04-22T21:20:01Z&se=2023-05-31T05:20:01Z&spr=https&sv=2021-12-02&sr=c&sig=7Hb04rR6uzijvOjHdc70Xt9vyt4iEPx5i3AnoE20f%2Fg%3D'
account = 'https://sqlday2023.blob.core.windows.net'
url_base = 'http://data.gdeltproject.org/events/'
container = 'data'
unizpped_container = 'data/unizpped'
file_extension = 'csv'

def get_blob_service_client_sas( account, sas_token):
    account_url = account
    credential = sas_token
    blob_service_client = BlobServiceClient(account_url, credential=credential)

    return blob_service_client

def send_data_to_blob (container_client: ContainerClient, fileName:str):
    url = url_base+fileName


    print (f'url: {url}')

    file = fileName.split('.')[0]
    file_to_save = file +'.'+file_extension

    r = requests.get(url, allow_redirects=True)
    zipDocument = zipfile.ZipFile(io.BytesIO(r.content))  
    
    listOfFileNames = zipDocument.namelist()

    for file in listOfFileNames:
        tmp = zipDocument.extract(file)
        print (f'file: {file}, p={tmp}')

        f = open (tmp,"r")
        content = f.read()

        blob_client = container_client.upload_blob(name=file, data=content, overwrite=True, blob_type="BlockBlob")

def upload_last_X_days(blob_service_client: BlobServiceClient, container_name: str, days: int):
    end_date = (datetime.today() - timedelta(days=1)).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
    start_date = (datetime.today() - timedelta(days=days)).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")

    upload_blob_file_for_dates(blob_service_client, container_name,start_date,end_date )
